intro: Oreocharis benthamii var. reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves with a distinct, reticulate pattern on the underside. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in the spring and attract various pollinators.
